content: pattern notes ● you can use any colors you like for your ornaments but to achieve the stained glass look color b should be black used in rnds 2 and 4 colors a and c can be any color special stitches stsc stacked single_crochet single_crochet in the indicated st then without doing a yo insert your hook under the diagonal bar of the single_crochet see image below yo and pull up a loop yo and complete a second single_crochet as normal these 2 scs will be stacked one on top of the other - the same height as a usual double_crochet - and will replace the turning ch3 which usually leaves a gap between itself and the next stitch anyway this stitch will be counted as a double_crochet in all row-counts ldc long double_crochet yo and insert hook into the indicated space 2 row previous to below the one you are currently working yo and pull up a loop the top of the loop should lie evenly with the current row yo and pull through 2 loops yo and pull through remaining 2 loops note that the indicated group in row 2 is directly below the current working space in row 4 see image at right stained glass christmas ornament make 2 panels with ca make a magic_ring round 1 stsc *ch1 double_crochet into the ring* repeat from * to * 11 times ch1 slip_stitch into the top of the first st to join 12dc 12 ch1-space fasten_off ca join cb with a slip_stitch to any ch1-space from round 1 round 2 stsc double_crochet in same space *ch1 2dc in next ch1-space* repeat from * to * around to last space ch1 slip_stitch into the top of the first st to join 24dc 12 ch1-space fasten_off cb join cc with a slip_stitch to any ch1-space from round 2 round 3 stsc 2dc in same space *ch1 3dc in next ch1-space* repeat from * to * around to last space ch1 slip_stitch into the top of the first st to join 36dc 12 ch1-space fasten_off cc join cb with a slip_stitch to any ch1-space from round 3 round 4 stsc ldc in between dcs directly below in round 2 double_crochet in same ch1-space from round 3 *double_crochet in next ch1-space ldc in between dcs directly below in round 2 double_crochet in same ch1-space from round 3* repeat from * to * around to last space slip_stitch into the top of the first st to join 12ldc 24dc fasten_off cb holding the two panels with their wrong sides facing each other use a whip stitch or mattress stitch to sew them repeat for the second panel when finished leave a long tail for sewing when you fasten off thread the long tail onto a yarn needle together when you are about halfway around the stitched seam slip the plastic ornament blank into the pocket and continue stitching tie a knot and finish the seam leaving the hanging hardware outside the open space
